p: In areas outside the current distribution that are projected to become climatically suitable in the future, the management response could include active translocation or restoration of grassland species, to increase landscape connectivity and conserve species of particular social or cultural value. However, the emphasis should be directed towards species or ecotypes expected to be more tolerant of new conditions [ 62]. In locations where the climate becomes unsuitable for the dominant species, weed control will be important to support the transition to new native dominant species.
